requirements.description: The system must port Python orchestrator files (orchestrator.py and planning_orchestrator.py) to Rust
The system must analyze the architecture of the existing Python implementation before porting
The system must provide Rust crate recommendations for equivalent functionality to Python libraries
The system must document implementation patterns and best practices for the Rust port
The system must define project structure and module organization for the Rust implementation
The system must provide a porting strategy and roadmap with clear phases
The orchestrator must handle 1,963 lines of subprocess-based CLI orchestration code
The system must manage feature tracking functionality from the Python implementation
The system must support session logging as implemented in the Python version
The system must integrate with Claude Code as the Python implementation does
The system must use clap v4.5+ with derive macros for CLI argument parsing
The system must use duct crate for shell-like subprocess pipelines
The system must use serde and serde_json for JSON handling
The system must use anyhow for error handling in applications
The system must use inquire or dialoguer for interactive prompts
The system must use owo-colors for terminal color output
The system must use config crate and dotenv for configuration management
The system must use tracing or log with env_logger for logging
The system must use assert_cmd and assert_fs for CLI integration testing
The orchestrator.py port must handle 1,367 lines of autonomous project builder code
The orchestrator.py port must support feature complexity detection
The orchestrator.py port must support MCP setup functionality
The orchestrator.py port must support session orchestration
The orchestrator.py port must support git integration
The orchestrator.py port must support QA test generation
The planning_orchestrator.py port must handle 596 lines of planning pipeline code
The planning_orchestrator.py port must support resume and checkpoint functionality
The planning_orchestrator.py port must support interactive prompts
The planning_orchestrator.py port must support beads integration
The planning_orchestrator.py port must support multi-step pipeline execution
The system must define ProjectInfo struct with name, path, stack, description, model, mcp_preset, and include_qa fields
The system must define Feature struct with id, name, description, category, priority, dependencies, tests, passes, blocked, and complexity fields
The system must define ClaudeResult struct with success, output, error, elapsed, and returncode fields
The system must support HARNESS_PATH configuration from CONTEXT_ENGINE_PATH environment variable
The system must support DEFAULT_MODEL configuration with 'sonnet' or 'opus' options
The system must enforce MAX_SESSIONS limit of 100 for safety
The system must enforce SESSION_TIMEOUT of 3600 seconds
The system must support RETRY_DELAY of 5 seconds for failed operations
The system must support global DEBUG flag via CLI
The system must load and parse feature_list.json files
The system must save feature_list.json files with proper formatting
The system must implement feature complexity detection algorithm from lines 39-101 of orchestrator.py
The system must detect high complexity features based on security, crypto, and encryption keywords
The system must support dependency-aware feature selection
The system must verify all feature dependencies are met before selection
The system must sync features with git history
The system must query git history to determine if features are already implemented
The system must run claude CLI commands with subprocess execution
The system must support captured output mode for claude execution
The system must support interactive TTY mode for claude execution
The system must pass --permission-mode bypassPermissions to claude CLI
The system must pass --output-format text to claude CLI
The system must measure elapsed time for claude command execution
The system must capture stdout and stderr from subprocess execution
The system must handle non-zero exit codes as errors
The system must support timeout for subprocess execution
The system must log sessions in JSON format
The system must log sessions in text format
The system must track consecutive failures during orchestration
The system must implement main orchestration loop from lines 1171-1245 of orchestrator.py
The system must display progress updates during orchestration
The system must render progress bars
The system must support ANSI color codes for terminal output
The system must provide color helper functions for status output
The system must parse command-line arguments for orchestrator CLI
The system must parse command-line arguments for planning orchestrator CLI
The system must support --project argument for project path specification
The system must support --model argument with 'sonnet' or 'opus' options
The system must support --auto-approve flag for non-interactive mode
The system must support --resume flag for resuming interrupted pipelines
The system must support --resume-step argument for specifying resume point
The system must support resume steps: planning, requirement_decomposition, phase_decomposition
The system must support interactive project setup wizard
The system must support interactive MCP setup flow
The system must collect multi-line prompt input from users
The system must support interactive menu selection for file discovery
The system must support interactive confirmation prompts
The system must detect checkpoints in planning pipeline execution
The system must prompt for cleanup of previous checkpoints
The system must discover planning pipeline files in project directory
The system must execute planning pipeline from specified step
The system must integrate with beads issue tracker CLI
The system must parse beads JSON output
The system must create issues via beads CLI
The system must update issues via beads CLI
The system must list issues via beads CLI
The system must handle Ctrl+C gracefully in interactive mode
The system must validate all required arguments before execution
The system must check for prerequisite tools (claude, bd, git, bash)
The system must use which command to verify tool availability
The system must organize code into cli module for CLI handling
The system must organize code into orchestrator module for orchestration logic
The system must organize code into planning module for planning pipeline
The system must organize code into runners module for subprocess execution
The system must organize code into output module for terminal output
The system must provide types.rs for core type definitions
The system must provide error.rs for error type definitions
The system must provide lib.rs for library exports
The system must provide main.rs for CLI entry point and dispatch
The system must implement Phase 1 (Core Types & Configuration) in 1 day
The system must implement Phase 2 (Feature Management) in 1 day
The system must implement Phase 3 (Subprocess Runners) in 1 day
The system must implement Phase 4 (Session Orchestration) in 1 day
The system must implement Phase 5 (Planning Pipeline Integration) in 1 day
The system must implement Phase 6 (Interactive Prompts) in 0.5 day
The system must implement Phase 7 (Testing & Documentation) in 1 day
The system must implement Phase 8 (Performance & Polish) in 0.5 day
The system must complete all phases within 7 days total
The system must define core structs in types.rs during Phase 1
The system must implement config.rs with constants during Phase 1
The system must set up error.rs with anyhow integration during Phase 1
The system must create Cargo.toml with dependencies during Phase 1
The system must implement basic CLI skeleton in main.rs during Phase 1
The system must implement load_features function during Phase 2
The system must implement save_features function during Phase 2
The system must implement get_next_feature function during Phase 2
The system must implement detect_complexity function during Phase 2
The system must implement git history sync during Phase 2
The system must implement run_claude function during Phase 3
The system must implement run_claude_interactive function during Phase 3
The system must implement beads CLI wrappers during Phase 3
The system must implement git CLI wrappers during Phase 3
The system must implement timeout support during Phase 3
The system must implement log_session function during Phase 4
The system must implement orchestrate_implementation function during Phase 4
The system must implement progress bar rendering during Phase 4
The system must implement color output helpers during Phase 4
The system must implement planning CLI argument parsing during Phase 5
The system must implement resume flow during Phase 5
The system must implement checkpoint detection during Phase 5
The system must implement file discovery during Phase 5
The system must implement planning pipeline wrapper during Phase 5
The system must replace all input() calls with inquire during Phase 6
The system must implement project setup wizard during Phase 6
The system must implement MCP setup prompts during Phase 6
The system must implement menu selections during Phase 6
The system must implement confirmation prompts during Phase 6
The system must implement integration tests with assert_cmd during Phase 7
The system must implement unit tests for complexity detection during Phase 7
The system must implement unit tests for feature dependency resolution during Phase 7
The system must implement unit tests for JSON parsing during Phase 7
The system must write documentation during Phase 7
The system must profile subprocess execution during Phase 8
The system must add progress bars with indicatif during Phase 8
The system must implement parallel subprocess execution during Phase 8
The system must add shell completion generation during Phase 8
The system must optimize binary size during Phase 8
The system must achieve test coverage greater than 80%
The system must match or exceed Python implementation performance
The system must keep binary size under 20 MB
The system must keep memory usage under 50 MB RSS
The system must compile in under 2 minutes for clean builds
The system must document all public APIs
The system must support --help flag with all options
The system must load and parse feature_list.json from test fixtures
The system must produce same complexity detection results as Python for test features
The system must execute claude command and capture output
The system must create session logs with correct format
The system must work with interactive prompts in terminal
The system must run on Linux platform
The system must run on macOS platform
The system must run on Windows platform
The system must use standard library for path handling
The system must use chrono for date and time handling
The system must use regex crate for pattern matching
The system must support thiserror for library error types
The system must support pico-args as alternative to clap
The system must support simd-json as alternative to serde_json
The system must support colored as alternative to owo-colors
The system must support dialoguer as alternative to inquire
The system must support log with env_logger as alternative to tracing
The system must support envconfig as alternative to config crate
The system must support std::process::Command as alternative to duct
The system must support tokio::process for async subprocess management
The system must provide migration guide from Python implementation
The system must keep Python implementation running in parallel during development
The system must use Python as integration test oracle for output comparison
The system must support incremental migration starting with orchestrator.py
The system must support incremental migration followed by planning_orchestrator.py
The system must handle Python bridge for planning_pipeline in Phase 1
The system must port planning_pipeline to pure Rust in Phase 2
The system must support single binary with subcommands for orchestrator and planning
The system must support separate binaries for orchestrator and planning if needed
The system must use TOML format for configuration
The system must provide better type safety than Python dict-based approach
The system must eliminate silent bare except patterns from Python
The system must provide semantic error traces with context
The system must support zero-cost abstractions for performance
The system must compile to native machine code for speed
The system must support automatic NO_COLOR environment variable
The system must support automatic FORCE_COLOR environment variable
The system must detect TTY for automatic color output
The system must provide zero boilerplate JSON serialization with serde
The system must provide compile-time type checking for JSON
The system must support shell-like pipelines with duct operator
The system must provide automatic error handling for non-zero exit codes
The system must support cross-platform subprocess reliability
The system must support IO redirection in subprocess execution
The system must provide feature-rich interactive prompts with autocomplete
The system must provide validation in interactive prompts
The system must provide theming support in interactive prompts
The system must support multi-select in interactive prompts
The system must support date pickers in interactive prompts
The system must provide zero-allocation color output
The system must provide zero-dependency color output
The system must support structured logging with tracing
The system must support async-aware logging with tracing
The system must support simple logging with log and env_logger
The system must provide industry-standard JSON library with serde
The system must provide massive ecosystem support with serde
The system must provide de-facto standard CLI framework with clap
The system must provide automatic help generation with clap
The system must provide subcommand support with clap
The system must provide validation support with clap
The system must provide auto-completion support with clap
The system must provide perfect error handling for applications with anyhow
The system must provide context-rich error messages with anyhow
The system must provide dynamic error types with anyhow
The system must provide comprehensive date/time handling with chrono
The system must provide pattern matching with regex
The system must provide similar API to Python pathlib with PathBuf
The system must provide ergonomic error propagation with ? operator
The system must provide proper error propagation instead of dict returns
The system must validate approach after Phase 2 completion
The system must validate performance after Phase 4 completion
The system must validate test coverage after Phase 6 completion
The system must continue to Phase 3 if Phase 2 JSON parsing works
The system must continue to Phase 5 if Phase 4 orchestration works
The system must proceed to polish if Phase 6 tests pass
The system must re-evaluate approach if Phase 2 has significant issues
The system must consider async rewrite if Phase 4 has performance issues
The system must extend timeline if Phase 6 has major gaps
